title: Why report someone for being an unskilled player?
body:
Hello, i noticed in the reporting section after my last game that i could report someone for being an unskilled player. Why would you even have this option, obviously everyone in this community will be at different skill levels, but honestly why is this even an option. It just causes more problems and arguments. My next question is can you please take this off the selection, i could end up say being in a game with someone who has never played with before and if i were a mean person (By the way i'm not), if they died alot in the game after i could report them for being unskilled and then they would get into trouble with the tribunal. How is this fair? I understand this was an intial feature but it's morally wrong for me, how can i ever say someone else is unskilled when i may play the same way they do and suck but in my own way i play i dont. This come down ever so well when it come to champion selection, I know there are roles and lanes but sometimes i get attacked for using a certain support made character for support e.g. Soraka which i think is a solid pick for most ranked games since the rework.

Just food for thought

A good Samaratian

replies.body: The mouser over says that it isn't a punishable offence, but that you can report them so you will be less likely to be paired with them in the future. So I usually report people when they have a bad attitude with this so I (hopefully) won't have to play with them again.
It's contributed as feedback to Riot that helps them improve their matchmaking system.
It gives people a way to vent without actually having any punishments available for them, i use it on the odd occasion where someone has done nothing wrong but i'm mad at them for whatever reason.
getting reported for unskilled players gets them pared with people of lower skill (less wins, lvl, etc) making it stupid for all the people who want to go smurf...

if you read it it actually says this isnt a punishable offense all it does is (presumably) puts them in games with other people who have been "reported" for the same thing they dont get punished for it

The way I understand it the "unskilled" report option will "adjust" the persons MMR slightly to be lower so they're less likely to be matched above their skill level. Personally I only use it when there is a noticeable difference in skill levels, for example if it's clear the person is not skilled enough for where they got matched.

I very much doubt that or any theory like it. That leaves far too much player control. There could be some well known or connected player who says to everyone in his network "report [name] when you play with them" until they are lowered into oblivion, no matter what they do.

it was for normals in the old days. season 1 and before that. as no one reports unskilled much anymore, and on a smaller server, this balancing act doesnt come into play here in OCE.

its like when you make a fresh acc and it has those 4 options. basically enough reports and you start playing with the next tier of players.

It is used by Riot to detect people that may have been boosted. Similar to any report, a certain number will trigger it - if someone is being constantly reported as unskilled then Riot may take a look at the account for suspected boosting.

incorrect.

it was originally used for normal game MMR. to help normalize/balance peoples normal MMR. reports for unskilled DO NOT trigger anything rito side. its been said before.
so those people dont get matched with people with the same mmr as u
It's a "stress relief" option. It doesn't really do anything, but gives you an option to report someone that infuriated you.

To be honest, I think it's there so that the Tribunal can forever ignore people who use it as a reporting option. In that, they're likely just little angry people who often report because they had a bad game, not for legit reasons.
That actually is a good point now that u mention it, it could be there as to find out how many people just rage because they had a bad game.
People reported under the 'unskilled category' don't actually get punished for anything.
